website_summaries.verdict: A well-built, sturdy quad chair aimed for big and tall users, and one that is most likely to last through several outdoor seasons of regular use.
pros: Very rugged build, with screws attaching canvas to chair supports rather than rivets
Users like the quilted canvas back and seat as well as the multiple cup holders and pockets
Folds up compact enough to fit narrow RV storage cabinets
cons: Seat depth can make chair uncomfortable for some
Reinforced front edge of chair presses into the back of some owners’ legs and causes discomfort
A few reports of fabric tearing away from supports after several uses

customer_reviews.title: This is a ruggedly built chair designed to last for ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a ruggedly built chair designed to last for a long time. Only complaint I had initially was that the middle of the seat sagged to much, putting pressure on the backs of my legs in the front. I saw in another review a fix that someone figured with 2" wooden blocks. I figured out a simpler fix that seems to be working so far. Takes the pressure off the backs of my legs by allowing me to sit a little higher in the chair.
customer_reviews.author: LKMULLER

customer_reviews.title: Such a shame.
customer_reviews.text: I have had such high hopes for this camp chair. I opened it up; it came in a nice carry bag. Sat in the chair with TONS of room and high off the ground, and noticed 2 tears - one on the chair fabric, and one of the fabric straps used to anchor the arms was nearly torn in half. I have uploaded pictures, and as of now, one star. *Update* Returned the chair with tears for a new one. The replacement came quickly and met all my expectations. It's a quality product, just check the material immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: I've been through two of them. The first one the stitching was coming apart and screws constantly coming loose and losing them. Called customer service and after jumping through several hoops they sent out the actual seat part. Round two had some plastic or whatever it's made out part on the frame break and and they replaced the chair but on the replacement one of the poles wasn't even drilled or attached. I managed to cobble it with a part of the other. Screws still coming loose left and right. I haven't figured out a solution to that yet. I weigh 320. Just really not thrilled with them. I had high hopes.
customer_reviews.author: Zombie Dave

customer_reviews.title: Hit and miss product quality.
customer_reviews.text: I owned my first one for 2-3 years. Im a big guy and loved this sturdy chair. Lots of use as have 3 boys in year around sports. So I decided to buy again. Total piece of junk. Stitching came out in one spot in only a week. I didnt return because i loved my prior chair and thought this was one time problem. 4 weeks later, more stiching and connection failure. Im past the return deadline so im stuck with this one.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Thank You ALPS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have avoided folding chairs for AT LEAST 15 years. The day I got this chair I unwrapped it and started in! I sat down gently...no noise. I started to wiggle around...no noise. So I started to bounce around in it. GUESS WHAT...NO NOISE!!! I got up and flopped down in it a few times even! NADA!!! I broke a folding camping chair when I was about 28 and about 320 lbs. I am now 46 and right at 400 lbs. I am FINALLY going to be able to go to see my family play sports!!!! Go to see fireworks and bbqs. I am FINALLY going to have a FUN & ACTIVE SUMMER!!!! THANK YOU ALPS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Caro B

customer_reviews.title: Received chair with flaws and need to contact seller
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my stepson for his birthday and was very excited for its arrival. He unwrapped it last night, we were both pleased at first with the chair. It is sturdy and fits him well. He is 6’4” and weighs over 400#’s so we were both excited for a chair 5hat fits him. However the chair came with the seam unraveling at the back of the chair and it appears that this is also close to happening at several other spots, all due to poor stitching. We are so DISAPPOINTED!!! I don’t want to take his gift away and don’t know how to contact the seller. I need assistance with this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tall, heavier females love this chair [I.E. ME!!]
customer_reviews.text: After a particularly traumatizing incident at a fall festival with me and a flimsy camping chair I knew enough was enough. I'm an almost 6 foot heavy set woman and I needed a camping chair sturdy enough to hold me like no past relationship has. I googled around and found this model on some listacle and decided after reading the reviews that this was the chair for me. It hasn't dissapointed me yet! Convenient side pockets on both arms; cup holders; semi-padded seat. When you plop down in this chair you know you'll be held up no problem. I can rest easy - finally!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Read This, Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: After using the two chairs I bought, the screws are starting to come out and are stripped. Not only this, some of the screws have broken off! I now know where the screws my family have been finding are from and one of the chairs actually fell apart when someone was sitting in it causing them to have a minor injury! I will not buy this chair again not will I recommend! What is going on with quality? These screws are actually a plastic/nylon composite and not metal at all!
customer_reviews.author: Dru

customer_reviews.title: Love these, my 2nd purchase
customer_reviews.text: We started off buying 1 chair and then we all fell in love with it and sort of became a contest to see who could claim it. So I just bought another. WHen you sit in it, it feels like you just sat down in something made of welded steel & oak timbers. The accessory flap pockets are great too (because the cup slots are too small for large phones) The downsides are obvious - with this much ruggedness you get weight, making these quite a bit heavier than your normal camping chairs, and making them a bit more difficult to fold / pack up. However totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary R Zarback

customer_reviews.title: The most durable guide chair ever but with one flaw
customer_reviews.text: This chair is no lightweight but that is OK. It is not intended for lightweights. It is rugged and durable. However, the seating position is not correct but can easily be corrected. I agree with others that the seat is about 3 inches too low in the back placing uncomfortable pressure on the legs just above the knee. Like other reviewers, I added 3.5" blocks between the rear seat anchors and the frame. This raised the seat height perfectly. The chair is now comfortable and functional.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Regier

customer_reviews.title: Cloth/material is not UV resistant, breaks down after 9 months
customer_reviews.text: King Kong chair frame seems very tough and sturdy. But after 9 months use the arm rest straps broke and trim is dry rotting, or damaged from UV and/or combination of wear. The trim is VERY ITCHY on bare skin as it's coming apart.
customer_reviews.author: Kryz72

customer_reviews.title: Built like a brick ****house!
customer_reviews.text: So I'm 6'7" and 420lbs - I'm hard on chairs. I've had other chairs that make similar claims purchased from the big and tall conglomerate with which anyone reading this review is probably familiar. They broke. This one doesn't. The front supports are very sturdy, and the whole thing is make from double layers of some of the thickest nylon I've seen. Everything is reinforced and built WAY beyond a standard folding chair. The backpack straps on the bag are too small for me, but it's no biggie - I just carry it like a regular folding chair. In a word, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: ZacTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Scam!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not receive the chair I paid for. This chair only holds 400lbs but the description says it’s supposed to hold 800lbs. Extremely disappointed!! Awful chair!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and secure
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this. I'm no heavyweight - six-one and 180lbs. The chair is stable and comfy and the pouches are handy for my binoculars and iPad when I'm out birding. I do wish it had a sling attached to the chair so I didn't have to bother with the carry bag. I like that about our other Kijaro chairs.
customer_reviews.author: BobZoom

customer_reviews.title: Great chair - CRAPPY cup holders!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to ding this for super crappy, flimsy and too small sized cup holders. It’s very well made otherwise, just sad to see that part of the chair was given no thought or attention. We have two Mossy Oak chairs but needed one with a taller back for my husband - the Mossy Oak chairs have fantastic big/sturdy made cup holders - this Alps chair does not. He’s lost two drinks on the chair already 😩
customer_reviews.author: ocatchavez

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised With Small Issues
customer_reviews.text: Similarly to other reviewers, I can also attest that the chair is great sized and very sturdy. It's definitely sized for the big guys. But yeah you sit low in the back and the bars in the front put pressure under your thighs that either needs the higher seat rig job, or padding under your legs, maybe a blanket or towel. I'm willing to work around that issue simply because I feel confident in the chair. It's heavier that most folding chairs and you'll use the backpack style straps on the carry bag a lot most likely.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It can support 800lbs but not 485lbs for 2 monthsr 2
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair to replacean old outdoor chair I bought at a big box stores that wasn't rated to hold my weight but did for 3.5 years. All I did was replace broken rivets with bolts and it held up great. Saw this and thought it shouldn't have a problem holding up under me. 2days ago the arm rest strap broke,and the seat dips way to low and makes it extremely difficult to get out of to the point I can't use it anymore. I weigh 485 and this chair is rated to 800. I doubt that. Looks like I'll go back to the big box stores and get another like I had.
customer_reviews.author: Culver Family

customer_reviews.title: Great camp chair for a big man.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect folding chair for the big man. I'm 6'3" at 320lbs and this chair was great. One thing that you may consider on this and most any camp chair, go to the hardware store and pick up some 3/4" foam pipe insulation and put it on the cross bars on the front of the chair, then your legs will have padded foam bars they are sitting on for added comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Duprasi

customer_reviews.title: Well Made
customer_reviews.text: The chairs are very well made and sturdy. As some reviewers have noted there is some pressure on the back of your thighs when seated unless you are very tall. We will follow the suggestion of some of the reviewers to raise the back of the seat slightly and that should solve the problem. Otherwise we are pleased with the chairs and know they will serve us well when we are camping. It should be noted however that because the chairs are so well made, they may be a little heavy for some to carry for a long distance.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzrd

customer_reviews.title: Well built, solid chair, nice height.
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'4" and find the seat just about the perfect height for my long legs. My knees hurt in most chairs because the seats are too low, leaving my knees higher than my lap, and the awkward position bothers my knees. My only issue with camp chairs like these is that the front part of the seat can feel unconfortable because of the poles. This is also true of this chair. I solved the issue with an outdoor foam seat cushion. Now the chair is perfect. It is very sturdy and I expect it to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Marc G.

customer_reviews.title: Funniest looking chair ever
customer_reviews.text: Awaiting arrival day, package comes. Notice its pretty narrow,and long. Oddly box says "table" on side, not chair. Open box....and damned if its not a table. Either the Chinese exporter, the American importer or Amazon has a item code screwup or lousy warehouse workers ...whichever. somebody has lousy quality control. Knowing the hassle of trying to return something this big, plus the loss of my time, just decided to keep it and warn off future buyers. Total foul ups.
customer_reviews.author: DocSavage

customer_reviews.title: Best camp chair available
customer_reviews.text: The BEST quality folding chair EVER! I don't understand some of the negative reviews about people complaining about pain underneath their legs. This chair keeps you sitting upright and level way better than any of the other products available. I go camping a lot and have been doing it all my life and every single person that tried this chair out is blown away with the quality and the area where your butt sits is nice and flat and you don't sink down in it like some of the other brands. The one downside is it's a little heavier and bulky but that's a trade-off I'm willing to take
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this chair a few years now, it's still just as durable as the day I received it. Easy to carry, a little heavy but not too bad. Would definitely recommend. The only negative is that the seat has a significant dip, which makes it a bit difficult to get out of, and also makes the front bars pinch the outside thighs after a while. I have fixed this issue by adding a couple of firm throw pillows to the seat (annoying having to haul them, but better than having to ask for assistance to get out of the chair. And they make me high enough that the bars no longer pinch)
customer_reviews.author: Deidre Ham

customer_reviews.title: Solid chair
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a durable and practical camp chair. I'm 5'8" and under 200lbs but I am pleased with the ruggedness of this design and I have confidence the product will last. I am particularly fond of the two pouches hanging from either arm. I use them to keep my phone and other odds and ends. The chair itself is also very comfortable. I like the large design since I can sink forward just a bit and rest my head on the back of the chair. I would not recommend the chair for people under 5'6" since I think it would sit a bit high.
customer_reviews.author: Megan G.

customer_reviews.title: Great chair...but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these chairs in June. The chairs are very comfortable. However, the stitching on the arm rests and the front of the seats is already falling apart! The stitching just turned to dust! I am very disappointed. There is no way to successfully repair the damage. At $60. each I think they should have held up better. August 1, 2020 ~ Update: Still waiting to hear from someone on how to resolve this problem! Anyone?
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: OK chair.
customer_reviews.text: Like it. Wish I could love it, but I do not. Just got it so I really have no idea how it holds up. Looks sturdy and fairly well made. Nice pockets and standard cup holders. Pretty red color. Big and heavy. Easy to pack and unpack. Just wish it was a bit more comfortable to sit in. That I could lean back more. The back is so upright that I do not think this is going to be my favorite chair. I got four more chairs ordered. 2 from REI and 2 from Amazon. Hoping they will be more to my liking.
customer_reviews.author: O. Remme

customer_reviews.title: Made for a Gorilla
customer_reviews.text: As a 6'4" larger than average human, I find this chair to be great. The over engineering that went into this works great for me and seems like it is REALLY high quality. I bought two for my wife who is average size, but she likes it because of the sturdy feeling you get from the build quality of the chair. The poles feel like they have a thicker wall thickness than average chairs and are about as big a quarter. Beefy and good, comfy chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shorties don’t be afraid!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my chair and I packaged it. I am very pleased with my initial evaluation of the quality. This chair might actually hold 800lbs!! It opened nicely and didn’t sag when I sat down. The reviews I read about it being too tall for a short person had me nervous but it was not an issue for me. I am a 5’4’’ woman and was able to touch the ground with my feet and get up/down easily. I will update my review after a while of use but for now I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but I I'm a rather heavy person and the smaller sized chairs can't hold my weight. But this does, I and rather comfortably. I used it a couple times this summer when we went the lake beach and needed to have a chair.. If I were to improve it the arm rests aren't very big, but I but I like the built in cup holder the pouvh on the side is nice but doesn't open wide... I was going to put my book I had in it while I was away from the chair but it didn't fit
customer_reviews.author: Shannon OHare

customer_reviews.title: really nice chair
customer_reviews.text: Needed a new canvas chair for outside. This one is very sturdy - although for me I tend to lean back a tad too much (causes a bit of pressure on my thigh) so I may need a pillow. (This probably wouldn't be a problem if I was taller.) I will only take it outside when needed, however, and not leave it outside 24/7 (as I'm sure the canvas will rot as it did on another chair I had). I like the pockets on the side and I like the cup holders. Since it says weight capacity holds up to 800 pounds, it should last a long time. Very nicely made - heavy.
customer_reviews.author: DVD Watcher

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rave about this chair enough. I used it at the beach on vacation and though it is a little heavy to carry, it is made with quality materials. You can tell this is not a cheap chair and it is very comfortable. My husband didn't want me to buy him one but enjoyed using it when I laid out and will be making a surprise purchase for him so that he may also be comfortable next time we need to use them!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M

customer_reviews.title: Very good folding chair
customer_reviews.text: I received my chair and it seems to be everything it says it is. However the design under my legs needs to be redesigned. It puts pressure under my legs. I put a cushion in the chair and it seemed to fix the problem. Other than that it is a good value. My only problem is the bag that the chair came in had two holes a little bigger than a pencil. I would like to see if I could get a replacement bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much smaller than expected and very uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is super uncomfortable because of the front bar being too high. It's also much smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Best chair of its kind
customer_reviews.text: We have been spending a lot more time in the yard with the neighbors since COVID-19 started and appreciate a comfortable, easy to carry chair. This one is a little heavier than most, but the features are great and it's very sturdy. My husband researches everything and reads reviews; he selected this chair and when he liked it, I decided I needed one to replace my current chair.
customer_reviews.author: TXKateNVA

customer_reviews.title: Big Comfy Chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is more than I expected. It is very comfortable and extremely sturdy. The bag that comes with it makes it so easy to carry around. It has a little weight but nothing I couldn't handle. The convenient cupholder is a plus. Shipping was faster than expected. The price was very reasonable for this specific chair. I would definitely recommend to my plus size guys and gals.
customer_reviews.author: Kepkim

customer_reviews.title: I weigh 565lbs and it holds me just fine!
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical about buying a folding chair with a weight limit of 800lbs but figured I could always return it if nothing else. I was never more pleased to be wrong! I absolutely love this chair and believe that it will hold every bit of 800lbs! This thing is a beast of a chair but looks just like one of lighter weight types. I did do the pool noodle trick to raise the back of the seat a few inches to make it easier to stand up from, after reading other reviews. If I could I would give it 10 stars! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
customer_reviews.author: Neil B

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for larger folks.
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with the chair. I’m a decent size guy (6’3”, 390lbs) and this chair handles me no problem. If I stick my legs out straight the bottom of the chair tends to cut into the bottom of my legs. If I keep my legs bent, I don’t encounter this problem. I liked the chair enough that I bought a second one, which is probably the best review I can give it. If I had to give any negatives, I would just point out that the chair is not small and it isn’t light.
customer_reviews.author: Rht3232

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, strong
customer_reviews.text: Simply put I weigh 280 lb and this thing was as sturdy as a rock. When pushing off the chair as I'm getting out, it doesn't feel like it's going to break in half like most chairs do. It feels sturdy. The pockets behind and on the sides of the chair come in super handy. The color wasn't bad either. My girlfriend was jealous so had to get her one too. Even my puppy likes it so the photo shows.
customer_reviews.author: Art Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but heavy
customer_reviews.text: A very sturdy chair! We got this for a relative who visits and didn't feel comfortable in regular camping chairs. Because it's so sturdy it's kind of heavy to carry, so we either strapped it with a bungee cord to the rolling cooler or put it in a rolling cart with other non-perishables (plates, cutlery, buns) for cookouts and outings. She's a little over 300lbs and loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but heavy
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely sturdy. I'm over 300 pounds now and needed something that wasn't going to disintegrate after a few months or a year and fall apart under me embarrassing me. This is definitely sturdy and functional but it is HEAVY. Grateful that the carrying tube actually has TWO straps so I can wear it over both shoulders like a backpack if I want to. Nice color, incidentally.
customer_reviews.author: Philomena Magnanimous

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of chairs that just don't hold up, this is the chair for you. In addition to being sturdy, it folds nicely. There are no added bars to flip around when setting it up or other strange stuff to deal with. It actually stands up on its feet when folded which can make storage a bit easier. The included bag is ok, but nothing special. It comes in a variety of colors and each seems to get priced individually. The colors also seem to go in and out of stock without much correlation.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Bob

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value for a chair that can really hold up
customer_reviews.text: We have some larger members of our family so I wanted to make sure this chair would stand up. It states and 800 lb. weight limit and it is true all the way. We even tested with two larger people and it withstood the abuse. It is extremely comfortable and a wide seat for those with some plumper rumps. Really one of the best values I have found in folding chairs anywhere, well worth it. Only minor downside is that it is a heavy chair but that is to be expecting for the durability provided.
customer_reviews.author: G. K.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but *warning* for people with short legs
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chair. Extremely heavy duty. But, it sits too tall for people with short legs. I am tall so it’s fantastic but the support bar will be uncomfortable for those with short legs. If you have short legs then you already deal with the reality your feet don’t touch the ground in many chairs. Right? If you need this chair for its strength/capacity, the support bar (under your thighs) will be very painful so pass on this chair or plan to always carry/find something to put under your feet.
customer_reviews.author: MikeDidIt

customer_reviews.title: No problems with this chair
customer_reviews.text: Great item. The chair has no assembly required. Comes in a fairly lengthy box, factoring in the length of the chair when legs are folded in. Its a wide chair, which is exactly wanted for a good lounging experience. No problems at all with any damage or torn material. Incredibly sturdy for a 230lb man. Two beer holders and side flaps for storage. Couldnt recommend this chair well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Buy a foot rest with it
customer_reviews.text: It's tall I'm 6'4 and it's to tall for me it cuts the blood flow to your legs off my legs were numb after 15 minutes of sitting in it .I bought this chair to take fishing and going to the drag strip ,It's not good for either I'm a big man it has plenty of room in the sit but it's not nice to sit in at all after the first few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: The King of collapsible chairs
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this chair now for 5 months with moderate use. So far it has been all that we have expected. When you first grab it, you can tell this is a well built chair that is going to last a very long time. It is not light but that is what I wanted. I wanted a chair that would last me 10 years. The only thing I could possibly complain about is comfort. But truly, what fold up chair is incredibly comfortable. This is the most comfortable one I’ve ever sat in. Do yourself a favor and buy this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chair!
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with this chair is that it is definitely made for someone taller. It can cut the circulation off in your legs if you are a bigger woman who is under 5'8". I did like that it holds my weight really well. I used it for my 4 day weekend at a music festival and it held up great. But it did cause my legs to go to sleep unless I was able to elevate them. Overall am very happy though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Got this chair 3 months ago and I use it daily , it is heavier than the other chairs you might find, but worth the weight. You can feel a noticable difference between this chair and others like the Coleman XXL. This chair is much sturdier in construction and fabric. I have purchased another one for company and will do so again in a yr or 2 when it's finally wore out. Btw I'm 6ft1. 300 lbs
customer_reviews.author: bigcountry

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better for taller folks
customer_reviews.text: The chair is beefy and holds my weight well, no issues there. My only complaint about the chair is that it might be better suited for really tall folks. I'm 5'10" and when I sit in it my feet barely touch the ground. This makes it very uncomfortable with legs dangling over the edge and your tippy-toes touching the ground. Getting out of the chair is quite the bit of entertainment for friends and family as my chunky butt struggles to get feet firmly planted on the ground, which causes me to have to lay back into the chair and then pull myself out. Quite the show.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to fold, sturdy to a degree that I didn't think possible.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome chair... very comfortable, easy to take up and down, folds up compactly. I have a rollup table from ALPS that I use with it. This is the first of their products that I have purchased, but I am exceptionally pleased, and will definitely look at their product lines first, if I am in the future interested in camping goods.
customer_reviews.author: James C. Westland

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but a few misses
customer_reviews.text: I am over 6 ft. tall and 250 lbs. I like the sturdiness of this chair and overall it seems to be holding up well. Two things that could be improved are: 1.) Either the butt area needs to be built so it doesn't sag as much or the front edge needs to be lower to avoid biting the underside of my legs. 2.) At least one of the cup holders should be larger. Currently they are both the same size and hold a can or bottle just fine but if you want something larger like a blender bottle or water bottle you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: JPW

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is solid. Much heavier than most chairs, and can hold some serious weight. I've had over 525# in it without an issue. Only complaint is the cup holders seem to be smaller than many other chairs I've tried. Would recommend. Lifetime customer.
customer_reviews.author: justin robbins

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: These are worth the extra cost. Very comfortable, wide, and sturdy. Cheaper chairs can be about as comfortable as an airline economy seat, these are like moving to first class. I live in Hawaii, if you’re going to spend days at Surfing or Paddling events, or just chillin’ with family and friends, the upgrade is worth a few extra bucks!
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Richard

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMP CHAIR FOR US LARGE PEOPLE.
customer_reviews.text: God I love this chair. I’m a big man 6’5 and 350 and I’ve broken a LOT of other foldable chairs who’s weight capacity was over 350. This thing is heavy duty! It’s not light but if you’re big enough to need this chair it shouldn’t be a problem. It’s sturdy especially when you are trying to get out of it. Also it does seem taller than average chairs, so it’s easier to get out of. Just can’t say enough good about this chair.
customer_reviews.author: elowef150

customer_reviews.title: Don't be impressed by the weight rating!
customer_reviews.text: I had really high Hope's for this chair, but it just didn't deliver on quality. One of the main support legs keeps bending out of position. It is one of the two rods that hold the back rest up, and no matter how many times I have tried to fix it it will still move back out of position because the rod itself has actually bent. So now since the return window has closed I am stuck with a chair that is very uncomfortable to sit in because that bent rod drives right into my ribcage. Absolutely not as sturdy as the description would.make you think it is!
customer_reviews.author: Travis Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy recommended
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’8 and 300 pounds. I was really worried about camping when my friends asked me to go, because I didn’t want to sit in a chair that I couldn’t get out of or was too tight around my hips. This chair lives up to its name! I had a wonderful weekend tent camping and had. O issues with the chair, extremely sturdy and easy to pack. I will be leaving it in my car for any bbq’s or backyard events. Shipped quickly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Bb2014

customer_reviews.title: Monster of a chair!
customer_reviews.text: This is a monster of a chair in every way. A male adult weighing 170-190 is gonna look like that kid from Harry Potter sitting in this chair. It is very sturdy and heavily constructed. Comfort wise, I didn't find it too comfortable because of the shape of the seat, it's hard to describe why it isn't as comfortable as other's that I sat in. Weighing about 13 pounds, you may wish you had the cheap 7 lb tailgating chairs if you have to lug a couple of these for any long distance. But then I guess you could also buy a rolling collapsible utility cart. These chairs should last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Its very strong and sturdy. As a bigger guy that wears between a ...
customer_reviews.text: Its very strong and sturdy. As a bigger guy that wears between a 3-4xl shirt I like to know my stuff is heavy duty. While this is built like german tank, Its only so so on the comfort level. I have a zero gravity folding lawn chair style and it is leaps and bounds ahead of this chair. It is much larger and harder to pack around so for little league games and things like this, it will do great. For a week of camping and relaxing I will pack the larger more comfortable chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Duff Mann

customer_reviews.title: Chair heighth is way too low
customer_reviews.text: I bouught this in july of 2019, but didn't use it till last week only to find out it is very low to the groun. I'm not sure why they would make a heavy duty (400# rating) for a man that sits so low! It's impossible to get out of the chair for me at 350#'s without assistance. Other than that, it's fine, but if I can't get out of the thing... then that's a problem!
customer_reviews.author: Buck P

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, quality chair.
customer_reviews.text: We have gone through multiple chairs trying to find a good one since our kids are constantly playing sports that we watch on the sidelines. Finally decided to try these and instantly they were keepers. We are not smaller people and they leave room for comfort. Super easy to fold up, I like the back pack option for carrying and that it is a good blend of firmness yet there is still enough give.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: The best chair you can buy for the Big Guy!
customer_reviews.text: The best camp chair you can buy if your a big man! I have owned 3 of these chairs over the years. I didn't buy them because they broke, but because I keep giving them to friends. These chairs frames hold up to plopping down in them, and the fabric holds up to years of use. If your a big guy then this is the chair for you!
customer_reviews.author: Slussman

customer_reviews.title: Well Built and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I watched the video on the product page and it pointed out that it had an extra support on the armrest. I was surprised what a big difference this made. I am a big guy and I can really lean on the armrest to get out of the chair. The chair feels much more sturdy than any other chair of this style I have purchased. Again, I am a big guy and have spent over $100 on a chair like this most often to be disappointed. Tis chair really feels like you are sitting in something supporting you.
customer_reviews.author: Tansey

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair, once foam blocks were installed.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Im 6ft3, 235 lbs. I made an adjustment to the chair. I cut up a giant pool noodle and made two, 2 inch blocks. I put these between the seat and the supports in the back of the chair. Others have used wood blocks or foam as I have. This raises the back up a little. Fits me fine now. I sit in this chair everyday. Very comfortable now. 👍
customer_reviews.author: joplin

customer_reviews.title: ok chair
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough, and fits my wide, heavy +500 lb behind. The braces along the front dig into my quads. After a long sit, they get quite sore. Being 6’5”, I wish it was taller and easier to get out of like a now-discontinued chair I used to buy. I will continue to use until I find a better, more comfortable option.
customer_reviews.author: KyE

customer_reviews.title: This is not made for the outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this three months ago, and the fabric edging has disintegrated. Whoever specified the fabric had no clue as to how consider weatherfastness for an outdoor item. This chair is garbage!
customer_reviews.author: mcinsand

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and comfortable. Should last. Heavy chair if you’re going to carry it for
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy chair. I can see why such a high weight limit, I have no concerns on it holding up but larger person sitting in it. Very comfortable to sit in. Only two ponds or it is rather heavy compared to a typical Coleman chair. Also the cupholders or rather on the small side. Fits a can but not much larger.
customer_reviews.author: klw

customer_reviews.title: time will tell
customer_reviews.text: Initial impressions are very positive. However, time will tell.....as a 250+ pounder this chair seems to be perfect. But, all the chairs I have had, 'seemed to be perfect' at first. IF it holds up and doesn't break apart like all the others, I would give this chair a 5 star, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: TLC.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty solid chair
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6'5" 300lbs I break alot of camping chairs. I used this one on my vacation for a week and was extremely impressed with it's heavy solid construction. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Chair- Strong and Sturdy BUT .......
customer_reviews.text: The chair is by far the best I've owned unfortunately mine arrived late and with a tear in the arm, picture attached. I've seen other reviews with similar feedback on damage. Other than that the chair is solid, I'm 6'1 320lbs and holds me no problem! no other chairs can say that, I know, I've been through several.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moreira

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and durable
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camp chair. Much more durable than your typical big box store, cheap camp chairs. It's a good bit wider than average and can actually hold up its claimed 300 lb weight limit. Yes, it is heavier than a flimsier chair, but that's a fair trade. Only real con is paying +$50 for a camp chair.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Comfortable, and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chair. I saw some complaints about it being uncomfortable for some people, a bar under your legs, but I haven't had much of a problem with it. I can feel where the bar is and I can imagine it might bother some people, but it is fine for me to sit in a few hours at a time while I am at my son's baseball games. I love how sturdy it is and that I don't feel like I am going to break it when I sit down, I highly recommend this chair. In case size help you with your decision, I am 6'1", 300-320lbs, I wear jeans with a 40"-42" waist and a 32" inseam.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chair, better for longer legs/taller people.
customer_reviews.text: Chair is well built & sturdy. However, I found it difficult to place my feet on the ground when sitting in the chair & it caused painful pressure under my legs at the edges where the arms met the seat canvas. Item did not ship as expected & delay was so long that I purchased another item (Coleman Big & Tall Quad Camping Chair) that was available immediately. Happier with the Coleman chair as I did not experience the leg discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: StandingRoomOnly

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair
customer_reviews.text: Look I am a fat mother effer and I chew through those cheap ass chairs like covid through Wuhan. This thing is the tits. I mean it sturdy like a 40's wet nurse. I will most likely buy another so I can leave on on my porch and take one with me when my fat ass goes public
customer_reviews.author: Jim lind

customer_reviews.title: I don't trust it
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unfold. Pretty color. Not comfortable to sit in -- the bar hits your thighs and is very uncomfortable. Also, it's not as high as I'd hoped. I have knee issues and can't get out of this easily. Bought it becuase the one I really wanted was out of stock. I should have waited.
customer_reviews.author: jan tetzlaff

customer_reviews.title: great chair.
customer_reviews.text: ive had this chair nearly 2 years. it is being used while im at work. if i had any complaint. it would be after a while the seat bottom sags down. causing pressure points on the back of the legs. i see others complaining as well about that. but its held up very well. been used every weekend for 2 years. still holding together fine. im thinking of ordering another one.
customer_reviews.author: unknown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the big fella!
customer_reviews.text: Are you a big fella? Are you scared to sit in the normal ordinary lawn/ stadium chairs, look no further, this is the perfect chaor for you!!! Im 300lbs and this chair is perfect, its actually my 2nd, still have the 1st one, its just pretty ratty after 6years. Big boy? Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: DiceZero

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Really like this chair. I use it 2-3 times a week. It is sturdy. It is comfortable. The only ‘not great’ thing is when unfolding the chair you have to push the back corners down individually. Not a big deal, but inconvenient. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Hsvdog

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and then went back and got another. We go to quite a few outdoor sporting events. If you want a chair that is roomy this is your chair. As for the comments that it hurts your legs across the front I did not have that problem and I have shorter legs. If that is a problem put a blanket or small throw pillow in the seat. This is a well made chair and I was sick of the cheap chairs which were not comfortable and do not hold up they are just a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lexie

customer_reviews.title: Good for tall, not for big
customer_reviews.text: Thought it would be great as I'm a bigger guy 450lbs. If I were maybe 3" taller it would probably be fine, but at 5'11" I'm just a bit too short. I can only sit in it for about 2 minuets before my legs start to hurt where the bars come down just below the cup holders. If I wedge a blanket, or pillow under my rear I can sit in it for about 5 minuets, but I woudln't suggest this so much for a big person, tall ok, but not big.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best camp chair EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Finally a chair that isn't falling apart after 3 uses! I've bought "heavy duty" camp chairs before and some have been just OK, others have started falling apart on first use. I'm 6'2" and 280 lbs. so I need a sturdy chair. That being said I am totally happy with this one. Even the places on the storage bag that normally rips is reinforced! Best camp chair I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Gone Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding chair
customer_reviews.text: I've been taking this chair to multi-day music festivals and casual camping for 5 years now. It's taken one hell of a beating. I've weighed anywhere between 200 and 250 lbs and it has performed flawlessly. This thing is a beast. The extra storage is a very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Sneake

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Love our chairs. We spend a lot of time in them with our kids playing so many sports. Very durable, tons of storage in the pockets, and easily packed/unpacked. These are wider than some normal sized chairs. Very comfortable. We had to buy more because we always argue over who gets to use this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jedidiah K.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chair - sits too low and that makes it hard to get up out of
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY sturdy, heavy chair. But we had to return it because when you sit in it, you sink quite low, and then it is hard for an older person to get up out of. The armrests are plenty strong, but the seat is just too low. Otherwise, it is a great, heavy chair - its solid enough that it probably really does handle an 800 lb load.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma in San Diego

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: Returning. This chair is to painful on your legs on the front edge of the chair. It cuts into your legs. Maybe this would work well for someone over 6 foot tall
customer_reviews.author: StressFreeLiving

customer_reviews.title: great chairs- but cup holders are small
customer_reviews.text: love the chairs- worth the money ( we have had for 2 months) but the cup holders are too small- must chairs have a reg. size & larger cup holder...this only has 2 reg (which are on the smaller side) cup holders and will not hold a lot of cups or your phone-
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Al Bundy would probably approve. But it’s not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I did not find this chair very comfortable. It put a lot of pressure on the underside of my thighs. It is very well built and sturdy for my 400 lbs Butt. But all that heavy duty ness can make it a challenge to get it back in the bag. Well built just not built for me.
customer_reviews.author: Car Audio Rep

customer_reviews.title: Solid, wide, but design flaw
customer_reviews.text: Some of the other reviewers had it correct, the back of the seat sinks down too low which makes your feet come up off the ground and puts a lot of pressure on the back of your legs near your knees. I'm 5'11", I'm not used to not having my feet reach the ground and it isn't pleasant. Will have to try a mod like others suggested.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Good Chair
customer_reviews.text: I'm tall & so many of this type chair are so low & I have a hard time getting out of at my age. Love the height.
customer_reviews.author: beachwine

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Holds a large amount of weight and seems durable so far. UPDATE. Chair did not even last 2 years. I am 300 lbs and this chair just broke last night.
customer_reviews.author: Norma MG

customer_reviews.title: Nice heavy duty quality chairs.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one to try out, as soon as I sat in it, I ordered 3 more. I hate flimsy chairs. This one is heavy duty. Quality fabric and frame. With heavy duty materials comes additional weight, so if you have to carry 2 or 3 a long way, better get creative and prepared for the weight. I’ll take quality over a little extra weight any day.
customer_reviews.author: Buffalobwana

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases this year!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this chair! Initially got the wrong chair sent and had to wait a bit longer for the correct one, but totally worth it! The only thing thats a pain is trying to fold this chair up. It collapses just fine, but the arm fabric doesn't tuck in very easy and you have to finaggle it when putting in in the cover. Love that the cover has adjustable straps, too! Makes it easy hauling to and from the fields.
customer_reviews.author: ChinchillaMeg

customer_reviews.title: tough chair, nicely set up, well built.
customer_reviews.text: The pockets are in good places, the side storage is nice, and I like that you can adjust the arms up and down. We leave ours outdoors more than we ought to, and the sun is hard on them, so this is our 2nd set. All in all, I don't mind paying nearly $50 for a chair that works this well, is comfy, and stands the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: If you’re looking for big and sturdy, you’re here!
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a comfy camp chair for a while when I stumbled upon a YouTube of this guy selling his version of a big boy chair. I’ve been down this road before and was disappointed with the build quality and dimensions. Not so here! It fit my 6’4” 320# frame with room left over! Super sturdy, made to last this chair brought comfort back to my vacations! Thanks ALPS Mountaineering!
customer_reviews.author: Reno

customer_reviews.title: Heavy But Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic chair. I can't say whether it actually holds 800 lbs but this is the sturdiest chair I've ever used and it's heavy so I really do believe it holds 800 lbs. The carrying case does have 2 straps though so you can carry it like a backpack
customer_reviews.author: mainedoc

customer_reviews.title: Great 375+ lbs
customer_reviews.text: Me and a buddy are very big, about 6-1 pushing 400. eek.. I brought one to a carshow and bbq for about 10hrs. VEry comfy. Everyone liked it as some took turns that didnt bring a chair. lol. Next to other XL sized chairs in my group you could definately see how better constucted this one is, and has more structural legs. also the armrest bends to let out the knees more. I love it. No problem moving around or getting up, slouching etc. its doesnt feel like its gonna buckle and collapse. Folding it up, to fit in teh bag can be a little tough.
customer_reviews.author: Nikon>Canon

customer_reviews.title: Saggy seat; hurts tail bone and thighs
customer_reviews.text: The seat sags badly, putting pressure on the tail bone and the bottom of the thighs as they dig in to the front lip of the seat, which is much firmer than the rest of the seat. I've seen others offer solutions like cutting up pool noodles to create makeshift spacers on the back bars, but that shouldn't be necessary for a $60 chair billed for high weight tolerance. You'd think seat would be one of the most important considerations, but it seems to be an afterthought. I will try the pool noodle solution, but otherwise am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. NSFW.
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. i was concerned about the gromets on the seat part being cheap or annoying but so far no issues with it. Ill give it a few months and update review. update: So after many months of owning this chair... i used it to sit my partner down and get on top of his lap. needless to say this chair has withstood 2 people over 250 pounds bouncing roughly.This is one durable as f_ck chair and great as a sex prop.Sturdy as hell.id buy it again 100x. buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, and comfortable. Highly recommend this chair to anyone looking for an upgrade from the cheap ones you get at the big box stores. It does sit higher than other chairs, so if you're on the shorter side your legs will dangle.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Christen

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 6.mths
customer_reviews.text: Broke in six months and I weigh about 200 lbs!
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Not for short or really heavy people.
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10" and 480 at the moment. The chair seems very well made and folds easily however...it is HELLA uncomfortable, with the bars digging harshly into the backs of my thighs and my feet were a good 4 inches off the ground. Immediate return.
customer_reviews.author: David G
